str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be slow, I delay, tarry. From bradus; to delay.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A promise. From epaggello; an announcement.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.
Tardiness, slowness, delay. From bradus; tardiness.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From the same as makrothumos; to be long-spirited, i.e. forbearing or patient.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From chora; to be in space, i.e. to pass, enter, or to hold, admit.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From metanoeo; compunction; by implication, reversal (another's) decision).
